User Story: As a user, I want to read engaging narrative content that matches my selected world so I can immerse myself in the story.
Acceptance Criteria:
The AI Service generates narrative text that aligns with the selected world's genre and description
Generated content follows the basic tone inferred from world description
The system maintains narrative context between generated segments
Content is engaging and encourages continued interaction
Narrative segments are of appropriate length (neither too short nor excessively long)

User Story: As a user, I want the narrative to acknowledge my character's attributes and skills so the story feels personalized.
Acceptance Criteria:
Generated narrative incorporates the active character's name throughout the story
Character's primary attributes influence narrative descriptions when relevant
Character's skills are acknowledged in appropriate situations
Narrative respects character background information
Character traits affect how NPCs interact with the player character

User Story: As a user, I want content that respects my chosen tone settings so the narrative style meets my expectations.
Acceptance Criteria:
The AI Service respects tone settings specified in the world configuration
Content adheres to the selected content rating and maturity level
Generated narrative maintains a consistent tone throughout the session
Narrative style (serious, humorous, dramatic, etc.) aligns with world settings
Language complexity is appropriate for the selected world

User Story: As a user, I want properly formatted text with paragraphs and dialogue so it's easy to read.
Acceptance Criteria:
Narrative text is formatted with standard paragraph breaks
Dialogue is formatted with appropriate quotation marks and attribution
Important elements receive proper emphasis through formatting
Text is visually organized for easy reading
Formatting is consistent across all narrative segments

User Story: As a user, I want to make meaningful decisions that affect the narrative so I feel agency in the story.
Acceptance Criteria:
The system presents 3-4 distinct choices at appropriate narrative junctures
Each choice offers a meaningfully different approach to the situation
Player selections are recorded and tracked by the system
Choices feel significant rather than superficial
Decisions influence the direction of the narrative
